intro: Sibara runcinata, commonly known as the slender sibara, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Sibara runcinata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
